docs.lead_paragraph: The single mother was already raising four children, ages 1 to 4, and the police say she was apparently overwhelmed by the prospect of caring for a fifth. She gave birth, alone, in her apartment in Paterson about 2 a.m. Monday, the police said. About 7 that evening, after buying the infant $86 worth of clothing, diapers and formula, she abandoned the baby boy, bundled in jackets, hat and blankets in a car seat, leaving him in a Sears parking lot here. Then she sat in the darkness in her car with the four children and waited until a shopper discovered the infant and called a security guard.

headline.main: Single Mother Is Charged With Leaving Infant in Lot

docs.abstract: Michelle Booker, single mother who was already raising four children, is charged with child endangerment for abandoning her baby boy in Hackensack, NJ (S)
docs.snippet: The single mother was already raising four children, ages 1 to 4, and the police say she was apparently overwhelmed by the prospect of caring for a fifth.    She gave birth, alone, in her apartment in Paterson about 2 a.m. Monday, the police said....

docs.lead_paragraph: The obstetrician who carved his initials into a woman's belly after delivering her baby at Beth Israel Medical Center has been indicted, one of his lawyers said last night. The doctor, Allan Zarkin, plans to surrender today to the authorities, said his lawyer, Kenneth J. Platzer.

headline.main: Doctor Is Indicted In Carving of Patient

docs.abstract: Dr Allan Zarkin, obstetrician who carved his initials into woman's belly after delivering her baby at Beth Israel Medical Center, is indicted (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: Children born extremely prematurely, weighing 2 pounds or less at birth, experience significant learning difficulties that persist into their teenage years, a study has found. The researchers as well as experts not involved in the study said the findings should make parents, doctors and educators aware of the risks such children face and of the need for them to get help early.

headline.main: Tiniest Babies Face Hurdles To Learning

docs.abstract: Study by researchers at McMaster University in Ontario finds children born extremely prematurely, weighing 2 pounds or less at birth, experience significant learning difficulties that persist into teenage years (S)
docs.snippet: Children born extremely prematurely, weighing 2 pounds or less at birth, experience significant learning difficulties that persist into their teenage years, a study has found.    The researchers as well as experts not involved in the study said the...

docs.lead_paragraph: Everybody knows what a good mother is. She is a lot like apple pie: reassuringly firm on the outside, but soft, sweet, warm and bland within. A good mother gets pleasure from the comfort and pleasure of others. A good mother gets pleasure from being sliced, diced and eaten alive. Yet while everybody knows what a good mother is, and everybody wants one, nobody seems to know where to find her -- and with reason. That good mother, who gives infinitely and unstintingly, is, in the phrase of the primatologist Sarah Blaffer Hrdy, the woman that never evolved, nor could have.

headline.main: Primate Expert Explores Motherhood's Brutal Side
headline.kicker: SCIENTIST AT WORK: SARAH BLAFFER HRDY

docs.abstract: Interview with primatologist Sarah Blaffer Hrdy, author of book Mother Nature: A History of Mothers, Infants and Natural Selection, on how selective forces have shaped maternal behaviors, impulses and strategies over tens of thousands of years; photos (M)
